result.execSummary:
The defendant Cody J. Utgard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation today.
Concurrent with: Count 2 and 14CF142.

miscConds.notes: May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

May not vote until civil rights are restored. 
May not hold public office.
If not a US citizen may face deportation or potential loss of other civil rights. 
Absolute Sobriety.
Must provide a DNA sample with no surcharge. Must complete a Compas Evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Participate/complete all required programs of Probation.

timeConds.notes: Banked time for use by Probation Agent if necessary.

miscConds.notes: Must complete an Compas Evaluation and follow through with recommendations. Participate/complete required programs of Probation. Must provide DNA sample with no surcharge.
